review: its a great sequel to road to hill 30 ai is improved level design is also more various and less repetitive although at some point it still will give that feeling the game feels way more challenging and strategic and was much more enjoyable than the previous one the story takes a darker twist giving more depth to the characters  its a great tactical shooter that improves all that its predecessor created

review: this is a good sequel to road to hill 30 which i also played recently and on the xbox i appreciate that its based on a true story and that the levels are modeled after real locations the squad based tactics are fun to use while also being realistic ill admit it feels dated at times but world war ii games from this generation have an essence to them that is irreplaceable i played this with a steam controller in my living room and was pleased to discover that it worked well

review: earned in blood is definately a pinnacle of the series and i cant even imagine how devs were able to make such a radical improvement in just about 6 months after road to hill 30 came out eib basically improves every single aspect of the original game from weapon variety through ai to mission design and it expands the original game story it still uses unreal engine 20 but they managed some graphical tweaks as well and unlike its predecessor its rock solid not a single crash
